noun.description: The direction leading towards death. Only in "†to (one's) deathward", "to the deathward": towards death, to one's death. Compare lifewardarchaic and rare in later use.

adverb.description: In the direction of death, towards death.

adjective.description: Tending towards or leading to death.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in John Trevisa (c1342–?1402), translator. From death + -ward.
